title: Dead?
content:
Seriously, I remeber back in November of 2002 when I first came on here, this forum was sweet. We all were waiting for a possible release of CK 7-9.

But really, I think it's next to foolish to hope for the releases now. I mean, this largest fan forum, and it's not even really active.

Meh, I dunno. I long predicted PCKF would die along with it CK7-9, but it's rather depressing to see it.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]

(This is half about PCKF and CK7-9, so I couldn't figure out where to put it so put it here, lmao)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Dead??? Dead!!! Fudge you fool:
content:
This forum is not dead... it is rather alive!!! Thank you.

There are around 40 - 70 post a day (Approx - Correct me if I'm off, but it is a high number)

We still have hope!!! Much hope!!! Haven't you heard of the Keen Rebles? We are a group a valient young teens who will fight till their email accounts are deleted, and their IP addresses banned; all for the sake of making ID give us keen.

Okay, so I'm kidding, but please don't make such statements, until you have studied the facts. We are having an increase in members, and are making mods like never before! There are many people working on Keenish projects. This forum is very alive!!!

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Dead??? Dead!!! Fudge you fool:
content: the forum is quite active id say.

I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

Hey... I was approximate: Some days; there are around 40, some days... Ezboard prays that their server doesn't crash.

title: Re: 40 - 70
content:
Everyone, bad news, I have terminal cancer. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img]

I wouldn't say this board is dead, nor even dying. Yes, it has been more active in the past, but is that not the case with all boards? We have lost members, and gained members, and those that remain are diehard Keeners to the core. This board may have quietened down, but now it is stable, like a star that has gone nova and is settling down to billions of years of white dwarf shinning. We do not struggle on, we do not endure, we flourish.

I have looked apon dead boards, I have even seen two of my favourate boards collapse, seen the ever more infrequent posts, the members just not logging in anymore, the stagnating topics and lonely conversations with the last remainins core of users. I have seen the forgotten sites, the dead links and deleted content, and twice have I participated in that fateful topic 'This board is closing' I have talked to the moderators and admins, or those remaining and agreed that a board is dead. I have been present on the last day, posted my last post and tearfully watched the error screen the next day. And I tell you that the stunk of decay is far from the Keen community. Not when we have such talent producing such wonderful works as the planned movie and comic, the fanfictions and more.

Perhaps we will never see CK7-9, or maybe we can substitute XkyKeen4-6 for them. No one who has glanced at the face of a Keen mod [excepting mine perhaps] can say this board is for nought. Even if our board dies and the Keen community sinks into obscurity and deletion, is all that we created, the fanart, the animations, the mods and levelpacks, even if it is all lost, were they for nothing? Did they accomplish nothing? Did they not entertain and amuse us? Does not this board entertain, amuse, inspire and even challenge us?

At the end, and everything must have an end, at the end this board still was, and its being changed all of us. That is something that will never be destroyed, no matter what.


A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Teh scene is dead!!1one
content:
Ugh... this sounds like one of those 'Scene is Dead' topics that seem to crop up frequently at demoscene sites like pouet.net. As long as this place is here, I'm here, and I know the same applies to many of us who frequent the PCKF, and will do for many more to come.

We've got so many projects in the works, each one aiding to others' inspiration to produce their own, and the likes of z-1's WIP engine promise to directly spawn even more. This place isn't just about moaning that TUIT was never created, and maybe never will be. It's about reliving the golden era of DOS gaming and the incredible worlds of the Keen universe we've each travelled.

Whenever I think of Keen I still get that pang of nostalgia I'm sure we all know, and as long as that's alive, Keen's alive.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Teh scene is dead!!1one
content:
LL- I would never say this forum is for naught, but nonetheless, it lacks activity. I know a lot of forums that are much more active.

At any rate, I still wish Keen would return for 7-9... Bleh, but unfortunetly, it will never happen. (Well, never say never, I suppose =P)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Dead?
content:
Bah there are recent games that don't even have a forum anymore. It has been quite an achievement to keep the Keen fanbase alive.
Yes these forums are dying. It has been dying from the very start, because everyone in their hearts knows that the Keen fanbase can't last forever if their won't be a new Keen game. Although we have less active members and new projects than we had before I still think that this board is far from collapsing.-----------------

title: Dare to Dream.
content:
[hr]KeenRush [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Yes.. What about end's end? End's end is rebirth. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
[hr]Interesting... that was part of my dream yesterday morning. I was in the midst of some kind of armageddon scenario, in a skyscraper, at one time on the roof and later on a lower floor looking out a window at a volcano on the horizon which looked more like a sluggish nuclear explosion.

I was thinking about how I really didn't want to be there anticipating my oncoming destruction, but as I watched the crowd of people outside the window holding some kind of colourful festival I began thinking of what lay beyond, taking comfort in the fact that this was just the beginning.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]
